lines.text: Have you considered what you would look like if you were to go completely bald?
What?
Your name please.
Sherry Conley.
What is your present address?
Upstate Women's Prison.
Occupation?
At present, Gangbuster.
What possible difference could it make to you whether you move there or to the city jai?
Because movin' to the city jail is closer to the witness stand which is exactly the last place in the world I've decided I'm gonna be.
So that's really it then, isn't it?
Yeah.
Doesn't make any difference about the city jail. You've simply decided that as far as you're concerned everybody else can go hang.
You mean I've been keepin' this a secret from ya?
I hope you don't object to a person lookin' out their own window?
You'll know right away if I object to anything.
What do you do? Light up?
You ever lay a fat hand on my person again and the prison board'll hear about it before I'm dry!

Certain things in the beginning is more important to know than others. And other things is even more important than that. And one of the most important things in this place is don't volunteer for nothin'!
Like poor dumb sheep we're moved from barn to stall and nobody takes the trouble to tell us why. Its inhuman.
Well, if we're not the real life-size Boston blackies!
I guess maybe these old rags of mine must look like Easter Parade 1902.
Look, sister, I wouldn't know styles if you shoved them down my throat.
You sure of that, huh? Why? Because you had so many of them shoved down your throat?
What is it with a cop? Always gotta call you sister!
Like mother better?
What's she like, Vince?
Oh, just like the rest of 'em that come through the line-up. Smart-talkin'. Brassy. Third-class citizen.
Well, here's to the boys in the friendly trenches!
Skal!
No, I don't want to talk to the manager. I want to talk to the man that cooks those tastefully gay dinners.
The money I spend to make sure I got people in all the places where it counts, they can't even find out where they're hiding one lousy dame!

Never mind, peeping John. I made sure there was nothing left over for you to enjoy. Bad as it is in prison, having to share the privacy of your shower with all the other inmates, at least we don't have to put up with being slapped with the fat hands of the police! You've hauled men in for less!
You models must lead a gay life for yourselves, heh? Never have to worry about who's gonna pick up the dinner tab.
Hah!
It's not a gay life?
What's gay about blistered feet and a bunch of sleazy married guys with ideas that were stale when the Romans was eaten lions?
What did you do? Lie about your age?
Who to? They're more interested that you're a real built kid; not how old a real built kid.

He went on and said, eh, "Little girl like you shouldn't be waiting all alone for buses in this big, cold world. I'm gonna introduce you to friend of mine that makes bathing suits." So, I told him why I-I didn't know anything about how to make bathing suits. And he said, eh, " No, little lady, you wouldn't make 'em, you'd wear 'em." Then he went on to explain he didn't mean at beaches but at buyer shows were these, these outta town fellas, like himself, would come to pick up what ever looked good to 'em. And, eh, whatever looks good to these fellas is that old combination of, eh, most girl, least bathing suit, if you know what I mean.
Yeah, I think I do.
So, I, got the bathing suit job.
Men - they ought to trade themselves in for somethin' a girl really needs.
I walk out here, with no skirt, and your eyes bang out like you just found some long lost gold mines.
You can relax, honey.
Well, thanks, I intend to.

'Cause I could come back from ten years alone on the moon, half crazy, and watch you swimming and stripped at the Y for hours and walk out of there with no thoughts in my head except where I could get myself a good meal.
Now, that was a crummy thing to say.
Since when does a woman need a reason for changing her mind?
I thought newspaper reporters were supposed to be drunk by this time on Saturday night.
Just the one's with money.
Hey, Willoughby, aren't you afraid that stuff's going to spoil you for real police work?

[Reading pulp fiction novel, "He Stooped To Kill"]
The real thing is for six year olds. And the girls in these things, don't they ever get cold?
Not those girls.
Want to borrow it tonight?
Nah, anything sexier than "Popular Mechanics", I break out in a rash all over.
How come you haven't asked me for a date tonight?
Oh, maybe I figured it was Saturday night, you're all tied up.
Or, maybe you just don't like girls.
No, I never found anything I like better.
